content.description: Sit at the middle of the overhung face, below the triangle shaped hold.  Use small crimps and pinches to pull off the ground using the large block for feet.  Move straight up into the triangle shaped hold and then topout straight up using solid crimps at the lip.  Can be done as a V3 stand start matched on the triangle.
content.location: Right up the middle of this short face.

content.description: Sit start as for Barracuda, make moves up to the triangle shaped hold in the middle of the wall and then traverse left into and finish Sea Glass by moving out to the left arete.
content.location: Middle of the overhung face at Bass Rock out to the left arete.

content.description: This climb starts by pulling on to a triangular hold in the middle of the wall, both feet are on the large block that runs along the bottom of this face.  Work the left hand out to a small sidepull, work feet over and bump the left further out to a sharp quartz sidepull.  Adjust feet and track the right hand in to the first hold, readjust the feet again to move the left hand up to a crimp near the lip of the left arete and from there lock it off and cross the right hand over to the lip and pull an easy top out.
content.location: Park at the end of Bass Rock rd and walk down to the shore.  This face is at the point directly in front of the parking lot.  Walk 3-4 minutes out to the point and this boulder is facing the water 20' left of the low angle slab if you are looking out at the water.

content.description: Start on the left-most arete of this short wall.  Since this climb starts above the water, hop on to the arete as low down as you can and then work your way straight up. Warm up 'climb' very easy!
content.protection: The base of this climb is almost always under water. Pads may or may not be possible.
content.location: Left-most climb on this short wall. Easy decent around the back of the face.

content.description: Start this climb by grabbing a good hold, high and left in the crack between this rock and this wall to the left, right hand starts on good low hold under the right arete, pull on a left toe around the back of the boulder and stck on your right foot in front of it.  Pull on, readjust yourself, and set the right hand up at the top of the right arete.  Make a small deadpoint up to the arete on the top of this boulder. Once you have that with your right, flip your feet around and use funky feet first beta to get yourself set for the topout.
content.location: This climb works its way up the smaller boulder that is deposited on top of the wall that hosts all the rest of the problems. This climb tops out straight up and it does not use the left wall at any point.

content.description: Get both hands on the left face, pull on a right heel and begin to shuffle your way out of the 'cave' where the smaller boulder hangs over the main face of this wall.  Move out of the cave and use crimps along the top of the wall to traverse to the middle where you can easily top out.
content.location: Start all the way in the bottom of the 'cave.' Start below and to the left of where Burl Squirrel starts.

content.description: Fun but short overhanging wall close to the water at Bass Rock. The climbs utilize a huge block for feet that runs along the base of the overhang and allows for the small crimps on the face to be usable.  Pay attention to the tides when coming to this boulder. As you can see in the picture, there is a pool of water at the base of the overhang.  Rocks have been piled there so that during low tide you can throw pads down and climb, but they can get shifted around by the water.  If they are out of place, try to move them back under the overhangs so everyone can safely climb here.
